channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: OpenAI and Google outdo the mathletes, but not each other
item.description: OpenAI and Google's AI models achieved impressive results in a difficult math competition, but disputed how the other got their score.

item.title: Tesla’s retro-futuristic diner officially opens as Elon Musk hints at more locations
item.description: The Tesla Diner & Drive-In officially opened Monday and it seems Elon Musk is planning for more.

item.title: Leaked Memo: Anthropic CEO Says the Company Will Pursue Gulf State Investments After All
item.description: “Unfortunately, I think ‘No bad person should ever benefit from our success’ is a pretty difficult principle to run a business on,” wrote Anthropic CE...

item.title: Trump’s Commerce Secretary Loves Tariffs. His Former Investment Bank Is Taking Bets Against Them
item.description: A subsidiary of Cantor Fitzgerald, which is run by the sons of US commerce secretary Howard Lutnick, is letting clients essentially bet that President...

item.title: What’s Behind Gen Z’s Sex Recession?
item.description: On this episode of Uncanny Valley, author Carter Sherman breaks down the forces shaping Gen Z's unique relationship to sex.

item.title: EPA Employees Still in the Dark as Agency Dismantles Scientific Research Office
item.description: As the EPA moves to shut down the Office of Research and Development, leadership is unable to answer questions as basic as when it will close and how ...

item.title: Hackers exploiting SharePoint zero-day seen targeting government agencies
item.description: Thousands of SharePoint servers could be vulnerable to hackers, according to cybersecurity firms.

item.title: OpenAI's New CEO of Applications Strikes Hyper-Optimistic Tone in First Memo to Staff
item.description: Soon-to-be former Instacart CEO Fidji Simo sent a memo to OpenAI staff Monday laying out her vision for how AI will change the world.

item.title: ChatGPT users send 2.5 billion prompts a day
item.description: ChatGPT receives 2.5 billion prompts from global users every day.

item.title: Serial spyware founder Scott Zuckerman wants the FTC to unban him from the surveillance industry
item.description: The spyware maker was banned from the surveillance industry in 2021, but was caught flouting the ban less than a year later. Now the founder wants the...
